tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE training_materials (
    material_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    material_title VARCHAR(255),
    material_type VARCHAR(50),
    material_content TEXT,
    created_on TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE training_materials (
  material_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  material_name VARCHAR(50),
  material_description TEXT,
  material_type VARCHAR(20),
  upload_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE employees (
  employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  employee_name VARCHAR(50),
  department VARCHAR(50),
  role VARCHAR(50),
  hire_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE training_materials (
  material_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  material_name VARCHAR(50),
  material_type VARCHAR(30),
  category VARCHAR(30),
  created_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE employees (
  employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  employee_name VARCHAR(50),
  department VARCHAR(50),
  hire_date DATE,
  manager_id INT
)

CREATE TABLE progress_tracking (
  progress_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  employee_id INT,
  material_id INT,
  completion_date DATE,
  progress_status VARCHAR(20)
)

CREATE TABLE progress_tracking (
    tracking_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    material_id INT,
    completion_date DATE,
    progress_percentage DECIMAL(5,2)
);

CREATE TABLE TrainingMaterials (
  material_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  material_name TEXT NOT NULL,
  material_type TEXT,
  publish_date DATE,
  author TEXT,
  content TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE Employees (
  emp_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  emp_name TEXT NOT NULL,
  emp_email TEXT UNIQUE,
  emp_role TEXT,
  emp_department TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE SkillDevelopmentPrograms (
  program_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  program_name TEXT NOT NULL,
  program_type TEXT,
  start_date DATE,
  end_date DATE,
  description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE EmployeeTrainingRecords (
  record_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  emp_id INT REFERENCES Employees(emp_id),
  program_id INT REFERENCES SkillDevelopmentPrograms(program_id),
  completion_date DATE,
  progress TEXT
);
